name: Peanut Butter Banana Bites
description: A fun and nutritious snack made with bananas and peanut butter, perfect for kids.
instructions: Spread peanut butter on each slice.
Drizzle with honey and sprinkle with cinnamon if desired.
Serve immediately or refrigerate for a cool treat.
cookingNote: Make sure to use ripe bananas for the best taste and texture. These bites are also great when frozen for a cool snack during hot days.

name: Cheese and Crackers Fun Plate
description: An easy and playful snack plate with cheese and crackers to keep kids happy and full.
instructions: Top each cracker with a piece of cheddar cheese or a dollop of cream cheese.
Serve with apple slices on the side for added freshness.
cookingNote: Add a variety of cheese for more flavor. Kids enjoy this with a small cup of juice or milk.

name: Mini Veggie Quesadillas
description: A tasty and healthy option with cheese, spinach, and bell peppers packed in a whole wheat tortilla.
instructions: Heat a pan over medium heat and lightly brush with olive oil.
Place a tortilla on the pan, sprinkle with cheese, spinach, and bell peppers.
Top with another tortilla and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side until crispy.
Slice into small wedges and serve.
cookingNote: Feel free to add other veggies like tomatoes or corn for a different taste. You can also use non-dairy cheese for a vegan option.

name: Yogurt Parfait
description: A quick and refreshing snack with layers of yogurt, fruit, and granola.
instructions: Layer the Greek yogurt, berries, and granola in a small bowl or jar.
Drizzle with honey for added sweetness.
Serve immediately or refrigerate for later.
cookingNote: You can switch the fruits based on the season or your child's preferences. This parfait works as a great breakfast or a snack.

name: Apple Nachos
description: Sweet and crunchy apple nachos topped with peanut butter, granola, and chocolate chips.
instructions: Slice the apple into thin rounds.
Drizzle peanut butter and honey over the apple slices.
Top with granola and chocolate chips.
cookingNote: Feel free to add other toppings like raisins or coconut flakes for extra flavor. This is a fun snack for kids to prepare as well!
